Job Title: Senior EHS Specialist

Location: Baldwin Park, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Manufacturing, Strategy/Planning

Description:
Company Description:Caelux’s proprietary technologies improve the performance of any new crystalline silicon module,making solar energy more powerful and cost-effective. Headquartered in Baldwin Park, California,Caelux is at the forefront of the emerging science of perovskites, a special class of nanomaterials. Its flagship product, Caelux™ One is an innovative product that integrates seamlessly into existing PV module manufacturing processes, boosting performance, reducing installed costs, and accelerating the proliferation of solar.
Overview:We are seeking a highly skilled and dedicated Environmental, Health, and Safety (EHS) Specialistto join our team. As an EHS Specialist, you will play a crucial role in ensuring compliance withenvironmental, health, and safety regulations, implementing best practices, and fostering aculture of safety within our organization. Your primary responsibilities will include developingand implementing EHS programs, conducting audits and inspections, identifying potentialhazards, and providing training to employees. If you are passionate about promoting a safe andsustainable work environment and have a strong background in EHS management within theglass industry, we encourage you to apply.
Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Occupational Health and Safety, Environmental Science, Industrial Engineering, or a related field. Relevant certifications (e.g., CSP, CIH, CHMM) are highly desirable.Proven experience (3-5 years) working as an EHS Specialist, preferably in the glass industry or a related manufacturing environment.Strong knowledge of applicable environmental, health, and safety regulations, including OSHA, EPA, and other relevant regulatory bodies.Familiarity with glass manufacturing processes, equipment, and associated hazards.Ability to assess risks, develop practical solutions, and implement effective EHS programs to prevent incidents and ensure compliance.Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to deliver engaging training sessions and effectively communicate EHS requirements to all levels of the organization.Analytical mindset and attention to detail to conduct thorough inspections, investigations, and data analysis.Proficiency in using EHS management software and tools to track and report on EHS performance metrics.Strong problem-solving and decision-making skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously.Collaborative mindset with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams and build positive relationships with employees, management, regulatory agencies, and external stakeholders.
Why consider the opportunity?Caelux is a leading global company in the emerging field of perovskite solar technology.Work under an experienced leadership team with a track record of success in solar technology companies.Join a strong, financially funded start-up that is providing a new, innovative, powerful, and cost-effective product to the solar industry. Join a company that is committed to the task of reversing climate change through technology and innovation.Be on the ground floor of an emerging global leader that is disrupting the solar industry.Caelux is for motivated people who want to leave a positive impact on the world.Series A funded and building the first 100MW perovskite production line.
Compensation Range:DOE: $80,000 to $110,000

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
